item.title: Thoughts On Board Member Duties
item.description: Last weekend I was working at the concession stand. I’m a board member of the local recreation baseball league and the assigned team to work the stand didn’t show up. For those new to the economics of kid sports, the concession stand is where flexible spending comes from …
item.dc:creator: Andy R. Terrel

item.title: A Personal Apology to Jeremy Howard and the Community
item.description: I, Andy R. Terrel, issue a personal apology to Jeremy Howard and the Community for the handling of the JupyterCon 2020 Code of Conduct reports. As the ranking board member on the NumFOCUS Code of Conduct Enforcement Committee (COCEC), it was my duty to oversee a fair process and that …
item.dc:creator: Andy R. Terrel

item.title: Personal history of NumFOCUS
item.description:
A NumFOCUS History: Sustaining Open Source Scientific Codes

After a few of the last board meetings and discussions on board votes, I’ve been pondering a number of questions. Questions about who is NumFOCUS and why we exist. Where we are going and what problems in the world we would …
item.dc:creator: Andy R. Terrel
